title: Bug 10403 - Project creation confirmation missing for scrubbing bin directory
description: When users create a new project and specify an existing directory structure as the output folder, there should be a confirmation prompt to ensure that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt. Currently, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project and selects an existing directory structure as the output folder, there is no confirmation prompt to ensure that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
EB: Upon project creation, users should be prompted to confirm that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the software and navigate to the project creation screen. 
2. Select an existing directory structure as the output folder. 
3. Proceed with creating the project. Expected behavior: A confirmation prompt should appear, asking the user to confirm if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
